titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky vs. Thomas Turner, Indictment
CWG8936

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p: State of Kentucky Madison Circuit Sct
Pleas before the Hon W C Goodloe Judge of the Madison Circuit Court at the Court House in Richmond on the day of March 1861

Indictment
The Commonwealth of Kentucky
against
Thomas Turner

The Grand Jury of Madison County in the name and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky accuse Thomas Turner of the offense of carrying concealed weapons committed as follows viz -- The said Thomas Turner on the 18th day of March 1861 in the County aforesaid did carry concealed upon his person a deadly Weapon to wit, a Pistol -- against the peace and dignity of theCommonwealth of Kentucky --

Witnesses
Samuel Lowry
Socrates Parish
Frank Ball

A True Bill
Wm Smith Collins, Foreman
State of Kentucky: Madison Circuit Sct

I James M. Shackelford Clerk of the court aforesaid circuit do certify that
the preceding one page contain a full true and complete manuscript of the Indictment therein mentioned
Given under my hand the 10th day of July 1863 --

J M Shackelford Clerk
Fee for the Record ,50 cts,
Chgrd to Thomas Turner

Thos Turner
Pettn to remit fine
Refused to remit upon Judgt.
